Docs.summary: Gets the user-visible description of the route.
Docs.value: The description of the route, or null if none.

remarks.para: Gets the user-visible description of the route.
The route description describes the kind of destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied string, a model number or brand of device.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetName (context As Context) As String
.method public hidebysig instance string GetName(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: Context used to resolve the correct configuration to load
Docs.summary: Return the properly localized/resource user-visible name of this route.
Docs.returns: The user-visible name of a media route. This is the string presented to users who may select this as the active route.

remarks.para: Return the properly localized/resource user-visible name of this route.
The route name identifies the destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied name, an alias, or device serial number.

Docs.summary: Playback information indicating the playback volume is fixed, i.e. it cannot be controlled from this object.

remarks.para: Playback information indicating the playback volume is fixed, i.e. it cannot be controlled from this object. An example of fixed playback volume is a remote player, playing over HDMI where the user prefers to control the volume on the HDMI sink, rather than attenuate at the source.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property PresentationDisplay As Display
public: virtual property Android::Views::Display ^ PresentationDisplay { Android::Views::Display ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the Display that should be used by the application to show a android.app.Presentation on an external display when this route is selected.
Docs.value: The preferred presentation display to use when this route is selected or null if none.

remarks.para: Gets the Display that should be used by the application to show a android.app.Presentation on an external display when this route is selected. Depending on the route, this may only be valid if the route is currently selected.

The preferred presentation display may change independently of the route being selected or unselected. For example, the presentation display of the default system route may change when an external HDMI display is connected or disconnected even though the route itself has not changed.
This method may return null if there is no external display associated with the route or if the display is not ready to show UI yet.

The application should listen for changes to the presentation display using the Callback#onRoutePresentationDisplayChanged callback and show or dismiss its android.app.Presentation accordingly when the display becomes available or is removed.
This method only makes sense for #ROUTE_TYPE_LIVE_VIDEO live video routes.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property Tag As Object
public: virtual property Java::Lang::Object ^ Tag { Java::Lang::Object ^ get(); void set(Java::Lang::Object ^ value); };
public virtual Java.Lang.Object Tag { get; set; }
member this.Tag : Java.Lang.Object with get, set

Docs.param: Arbitrary, app-specific data for this route to hold for later use
Docs.summary: Set an application-specific tag object for this route.
Docs.value: The tag object previously set by the application

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Property setter documentation:
Set an application-specific tag object for this route. The application may use this to store arbitrary data associated with the route for internal tracking.
Note that the lifespan of a route may be well past the lifespan of an Activity or other Context; take care that objects you store here will not keep more data in memory alive than you intend.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
